introduction: How did fast food spread around the world? For audio and transcript downloads, plus a quiz and a lis

vocabulary.definition: a confident and determined mindset to fix problems and achieve results
vocabulary.example: She approached the project with a can-do attitude and successfully completed it ahead of schedule.

vocabulary.definition: having existed for a long time
vocabulary.example: Their long-standing friendship dates back to their childhood.

vocabulary.definition: a different form or version of something
vocabulary.example: The restaurant offers a wide variation of pasta dishes on their menu.

vocabulary.definition: a group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words
vocabulary.example: Learning idioms in a new language can be challenging but enriching.

vocabulary.definition: a piece of paper with questions or tasks for students to work on
vocabulary.example: The teacher handed out a worksheet to assess the students' understanding of the lesson.

vocabulary.definition: to summarize or review the main points
vocabulary.example: Before the exam, it's helpful to recap the key concepts from each chapter.

vocabulary.definition: a set of circumstances that makes it possible to do something
vocabulary.example: Studying abroad provides an excellent opportunity to immerse yourself in a different culture.

vocabulary.definition: accomplishing an aim or purpose with favorable results
vocabulary.example: The entrepreneur's innovative idea led to a successful business venture.
